English (United States)(en-US): Dot goes outside.
I hope Dot has a safe journey home... Perhaps I'll spy on them with my binoculars.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘도 무사히 돌아올 수 있을런지. 쌍안경으로 뭉치를 구경해 볼까?

English (United States)(en-US): Thump... Thump... Splat.
I'm going to observe some humans. Meanwhile, please look over my mold friend's mumblings!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들을 구경하고 올게. 그동안 내 친구 곰팡이의 혼잣말을 지켜봐 줘!

English (United States)(en-US): Today, I failed to go outside.
I don't want you ever to see me in my melted state. Please, don't open the door.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 녹아 버린 몸을 너는 보지 않았으면 좋겠어. 절대 문을 열지 말아 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe I'll lose my way?
The Earth is too far and wide to find Dot. Will Dot be... Okay?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치를 되찾기에 지구는 너무 넓다. 뭉치... 괜찮을까?

English (United States)(en-US): A monster who couldn't go outside.
My grey-brown corner is a fortress of contemplation. Leave me be in my melted state, just for a while.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 회갈색 모퉁이는 사념의 요새야. 잠시만, 잠시만 녹아 있을게.

English (United States)(en-US): A black blob falling out the window?
I left a little note. I'll be back soon, <nickname>!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 작은 쪽지를 남겨 두었어. 금방 다녀올게, <nickname>!

English (United States)(en-US): Could it be... Dot?
Breaking news: Several sightings of an unidentified black monster near the local elementary school have been reported.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인근 초등학교 등굣길, 몇몇 학생들이 정체불명의 검은 괴물을 포착했다는 소식입니다.

English (United States)(en-US): Um, by any chance, have you done what's called 'cleaning'?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹시 너, 청소라는 걸 했어? 에이... 설마. 설마. 아니지?

English (United States)(en-US): I feel a bit strange today.
I have a bad feeling... But I should go anyway.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 밖에 나가면 안 될 것 같은 예감... 그래도 가 봐야겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): My footprints are melting.
Disappearing without a trace is a bit lonely.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 흔적도 없이 사라지는 건 조금 외로운 일이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Fog. Thick fog.
I can't see ahead... But I memorized the way home.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 앞이 안 보여도 괜찮아. 집으로 가는 길은 외웠거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Today feels extra far.
I don't have legs. So why do they hurt?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다리가 없는데 왜 다리가 아픈 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): My last walk will be in my mind.
When I close my eyes, I see the universe.
You know, I have something to tell you!
That is... That is... That is... Uh-oh, what's happening to me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건..., 그건..., 그건.... 어어, 나 왜 이러지?

English (United States)(en-US): This is serious. If nothing changes, it will all burn down.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 큰일이야. 이러다간 다 타 버리고 말겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): There was a colossal fire within him. How did it come to this?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마음속에 집채만 한 불길이 있는 사람을 봤어!

English (United States)(en-US): Choose your face.
How do you fell about putting on this head today?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘은 이런 머리를 쓰면 어떨 것 같아?

English (United States)(en-US): The kind of day you want to stand under a metaphorical umbrella.
Dot's eyes seem to disappear when they're feeling melancholy...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치는 우울할 때면 눈이 사라지는 괴물인 것 같다...

English (United States)(en-US): Will you come to the party? I know it's a bit late, but still!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파티에 와 줄 수 있겠어? 늦었지만!

English (United States)(en-US): Because I have to face the end of this festival you undoubtedly have put much effort into.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 분명 공들여 준비했을 축제의 끝을 바라봐야 하니까.

English (United States)(en-US): [Unable to Connect]
I want to get to know you so much more than I do now!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 궁금해! 너와 더 가까워지고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): I've become a dustball.
It stings a bit, but maybe that's not all that bad?
Twins inside the esophagus.
Something is squirming in their throat.
Huh? What's going on?
When's the last time you saw the mold?
Hello. Please hurry and shut this.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕. 서둘러 와서 이걸 닫아 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): Hello. Please hurry and shut this.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕. 서둘러 와서 이걸 닫아 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): What if you were to live in yesterday's dream forever?
I'm going to tell you a story about a dream that never disappears.
I don't want you to come by today.
I'll be in a state I don't want anyone to witness. (It's a lie.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 들키기 싫은 모습을 하고 있을 테니까. (거짓말이야.)

English (United States)(en-US): After farewell remains...
A sparkling sadness, like shells swept up the beach by waves.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파도가 지나간 해변 위 조개껍데기처럼 빛나는 슬픔.

English (United States)(en-US): The day the last grain of sand drops.
Let's have the greatest farewell in the universe!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우주에서 가장 멋진 작별 인사를 나누자!

English (United States)(en-US): I know I'm just a measly black monster.
But I want to tell you I love you. So I need you, right now!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑한다는 말을 꼭 해 보고 싶어. 그러니 지금, 네가 필요해!

English (United States)(en-US): Splat. (Rolling...) Splat. (Rolling...)
I'd like to stick to the wall a little better... Any ideas?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 벽에 더 잘 매달리고 싶은데... 무슨 방법이 없을까?

English (United States)(en-US): What do you think is inside the white hat?
With my chalk-drawn eyes, it only seems like a normal head.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 분필 눈으로 보니, 평범한 머리로 보이기만 하는데 말야.

English (United States)(en-US): It's something I can't ask Red myself...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드에게 직접 물어볼 수는 없는 이야기야...

English (United States)(en-US): So can you listen instead of me?
You could die one day too?
I'm not sure but... I thought it could be. Am I right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잘 모르지만... 그럴 수도 있겠다는 생각이 들었어.

English (United States)(en-US): [No Connection]
Am I the only one longing?
Dot turns into a great big dustball...
But it's really not so bad. Do you want to come check me out?
Spit it out. Spit it out.
But I don't know how. Will you help me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 여전히 방법을 모르겠어. 도와 줄래?

English (United States)(en-US): I can't find it anywhere!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어디에도 보이지 않아! 미칠 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Where did my precious friend 'disappear' to?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대체 어디로 '사라져 버린' 거야. 나의 소중한 친구.

English (United States)(en-US): Hello. Hurry, hurry, come and shut 'this'.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕. 서둘러 서둘러 와 와서 '이걸' 닫아줘.

English (United States)(en-US): Please shut this for me? I'm begging you.
In certain dreams, you know...
Someone you love is waiting. I'm not a 'someone', but I'm waiting for you too!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑하는 사람이 기다리고 있어. '사람'은 아니지만, 나도 널 기다려.

English (United States)(en-US): That's okay. You don't have to come.
The speed at which I'm melting doesn't seem that fast.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 녹아가는 속도는 그다지 빠르지 않은 것 같네.

English (United States)(en-US): You know the big tree you can see from the window?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 창가에 앉으면 보이는 커다란 나무 알지?

English (United States)(en-US): Today I want to tell you a story about that tree.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘은 그 나무에 대한 이야기를 들려주려 해.

English (United States)(en-US): I'm ready.
So I want to gaze beyond the world with you. Way beyond there.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 너와 세상 너머를 바라보고 싶어. 저어기 너머를.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot oozes out from a pile of books...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 책더미 속에서 흐물흐물 기어 나옵니다...

English (United States)(en-US): I've realized something about love.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나, 사랑에 대하여 깨달은 게 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Emptiness...
Some things grow emptier the more you try to fill them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 채우려 할수록 더 비어가는 것들이 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Okay. I'm completely ready.
Let me observe your true self.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 본모습을 관찰할 수 있게 해줘.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot carefully calls for you...
Are you there? Well... I need your help.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 거기에 있어? 하고 싶은 말이 있어. 실은... 네 도움이 필요해.

English (United States)(en-US): Hurry to me.
I have something urgent to tell you!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 언젠가 죽게 될 너에게, 긴히 전할 말이 있어!

English (United States)(en-US): Hurry to me.
I have something urgent to tell you—you who will someday die.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 언젠가 죽게 될 너에게, 긴히 전할 말이 있어!

English (United States)(en-US): Dot sits quietly in place.
Can you hear the strange discord hiding in the silence?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고요 속에 숨은, 원인 모를 불협화음을 들을 수 있나요?

English (United States)(en-US): (The closet feels darker than usual today.)
Something I had to hold back.
Still holding it in? Or did you finally let it out?
About the mold... I'm over it now.
But something about that dream keeps bothering me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 꿈에 대해 마음에 걸리는 점이 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): I'm going to tell a dark story.
It needs to be told. Shall I go on if you're okay?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꼭 짚어야 하는 내용이거든. 너만 괜찮다면 계속할까?

English (United States)(en-US): The trap of sweet illusion.
When shadows approach I want to throw myself into it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그림자가 다가올 때면 그 덫에 몸을 던지고 싶어져.

English (United States)(en-US): Into the vast darkness.
I'm sinking. Or am I actually rising?
Remember? The day I tried to leave.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 기억 나? 내가 떠나려고 했던 날.

English (United States)(en-US): All those memories and moments.
At the very end.
What color is the dream waiting for us?
Waiting so desperately for you.
I had a sudden epiphany about love. Won't you hear it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑에 대해 퐁 솟은 깨달음이 있단 말야. 들어주지 않을래?

English (United States)(en-US): Ah. My ring boy.
I want to continue his story.
If you don't want to be alone either
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너도 혼자 있고 싶은 게 아니라면

English (United States)(en-US): Let's keep talking. I'm waiting for you.
Dot has gone flat like a plate.
Dot may have spent some painful time alone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치는 홀로 조금 고통스러운 시간을 보낸 걸지도 몰라요.

English (United States)(en-US): More time has slipped away.
Does that mean your death draws nearer too, <nickname>—you whom I love?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그만큼 내가 사랑하는 인간인 <nickname>, 너의 죽음도... 가까워진 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): We're so far apart.
I don't even know why you're not coming.
(Gone forever? If you never come back...)
Even if it's suppressed.
Talking with you is my precious release.
Something I can't believe no matter how I try.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무리 믿을래도 믿을 수 없는 것

English (United States)(en-US): I'm thinking about a dream within a dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈을 꾸는 꿈에 대해 생각하고 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Okay. I'll wait.
Come find me when you're ready to talk about 'the dark thing'.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검은 것'에 대해 얘기해도 네가 괜찮을 때에 나를 찾아줘.

English (United States)(en-US): I have a confession.
The time we spend together, maybe it's also...
The darkness is drawing near.
Let me tell you that old story.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 오랜 이야기를 네게 들려 줄게.

English (United States)(en-US): How will you remember me?
I wonder what I'll look like etched in your time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 시간 속에 각인될 내가 궁금해.

English (United States)(en-US): Let's be together.
For all the words still left unsaid.
I brought a poem to wrap up today.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘을 정리할 시 한 편을 들고 왔어.

English (United States)(en-US): I wish I could share it with you!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너와 공유할 수 있다면 좋을 텐데!

English (United States)(en-US): I heard humans cry when they yawn.
I should be careful. My chalk eyes might smudge!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 조심해야겠어. 나의 분필 눈이 지워질지도 모르니!

English (United States)(en-US): If I could read a poem before sleep
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠들기 전 시를 읽을 수 있다면

English (United States)(en-US): I'd be so, so happy!
Did you know? A poem before bed...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것 알아? 자기 전에 읽는 시가...

English (United States)(en-US): Actually helps you have good dreams!
Poem's ready.
Now I just need you to come!
My eyes keep closing...
But I won't sleep yet. Not until you come!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 절대 잠들지 않겠어. 내 인간 친구가 돌아올 때까지는, 절대!

English (United States)(en-US): Today's poem is special.
It'll be even more special if we read it together!
